Organisation Purpose Amount USD Country Programme Sub Programme Year Awarded Duration
Terre des Femmes Switzerland (TDF) To support Terre des Femmes to provide comprehensive and culturally sensitive counselling services and assistance specifically designed for migrant women who are victims of domestic violence living in Bern, Switzerland. Terre des Femmes Switzerland works to prevent human rights violations against women and girls. 150'000.00 Switzerland Issues Affecting Women 2016 36 months (1 Mar 2016-28.02.2019)
Terre des hommes Foundation "Lausanne" in Hungary To strengthen systems and professional competencies to protect children's fundamental rights to be protected from abuse across South East Europe. This will be done by further developing and expanding the scope of the Child Protection Hub for South East Europe (ChildHub - childhub.org) - an online resource centre that provides technical assistance, knowledge and research to support policy and practice. 850'581.00 Hungary Prevent Child Sexual Abuse Preventing violence, protecting children 2017 35 months (01 Jan 2018-31 Dec 2020)
Terre des Hommes International Federation To provide support to the Children Win Campaign, which promotes child rights in the bidding processes of sporting organisers, and to the Destination Unknown Campaign, which works to protect children on the move. TDH works to defend and promote the rights of children. 499'699.00 Worldwide Prevent Child Sexual Abuse Strategic opportunities 2018 19 months (1 May 2018-31 Dec 2019)
Terre des hommes Moldova To prevent child abuse and improve the safety and wellbeing of children, particularly those living in rural communities in Moldova. Through this project, Terre des hommes Moldova plans to prevent violence among school children by transforming school culture, empowering children and equipping teachers with necessary knowledge and skills. It will increase parental capacities and tackle harmful social norms that permit violence against children. 382'832.00 Moldova Prevent Child Sexual Abuse Solutions and advancing action 2018 35 months (1 Oct 2018-30 Sep 2021)
Tharthi Myay Foundation To promote human rights and social justice in Myanmar through grant-making and capacity-building support to grassroots organisations. Tharthi Myay Foundation (TMF) has three programme areas: Human Rights and Legal Education; Gender Rights; and Inclusive Education (with a cross-cutting focus on individual rights). TMF assists local groups across the country to build collaborative platforms and strong networks to advocate for change at the national and regional levels. 3'000'000.00 Myanmar International Human Rights Supporting and protecting human rights defenders 2018 36 months (1 Jan 2018-1 Jan 2021)
The African Wildlife Foundation To support the African Wildlife Foundation’s project in the Savé Valley Conservancy in Zimbabwe, where it works to protect wildlife, including a critical population of rhinos. The conservancy seeks to improve its rhino protection programme and to facilitate the translocation of rhinos, in the long-term, to populate other areas. The project will provide critical salary and equipment support for rangers; enhance the existing intelligence gathering network; and allow for biological monitoring of the rhino population and maintenance of natural habitat. 700'000.00 Zimbabwe Special Interest 2018 47 months (1 Jul 2018-30 Jun 2022)
The African Wildlife Foundation To help protect elephant populations in Mana Pools National Park and the Lower Zambezi Valley in Zimbabwe, Africa by strengthening ranger capacity, supporting park management, investing in core infrastructure and establishing robust monitoring systems. The project addresses the threats that poaching operations pose to the park and surrounding landscape, thereby helping ensure the viability of one of Africa's most important elephant populations. 299'372.00 Zimbabwe Special Interest 2016 36 months (2 Jan 2017-31.12.2019)
The Andrei Sakharov Foundation -Commission for Academic Sakharov Heritage Preservation To provide core support to the Sakharov centre to promote Sakharovs values and memory and support its traditional activities, including public debate. This builds on existing efforts to target a younger generation through human rights education, photography and theatre. In addition it supports a new initiative to mobilise that same cohort into public service via volunteering. 450'000.00 Russia International Human Rights Broadening human rights constituencies 2018 35 months (1 Jan 2018-31 Dec 2020)
The Carlos Acosta International Dance Foundation To establish an international dance school in Cuba for underprivileged gifted and talented dancers from across the globe. The Carlos Acosta International Dance Foundation has a vision to create a world-renowned centre of excellence to give training and education to young dancers who would otherwise not have the opportunity. 1'000'000.00 United Kingdom Special Interest 2016 36 months (1 Sep 2016-30.08.2019)
The Conservation Fund To continue to build the capacity of grassroots organisations to plan, manage and implement programmes that increase access to healthy foods and connect limited-resource farmers with community markets to strengthen and build more inclusive local food systems. The Conservation Funds Resourceful Communities programme aims to increase food security so that community members can access, grow and distribute safe, affordable and local healthy food. 500'000.00 United States Special Interest 2017 23 months (01 May 2017-30 Apr 2019)
The Dr. Robert C. Cantu Concussion Center at Emerson Hospital To help launch the Dr. Robert Cantu Concussion Center to conduct research in the science of concussion management, return to play and inter-professional treatment protocols. The Center will also provide community education, timely health assessments, evidence-based recovery recommendations and treatment. 1'025'000.00 United States Special Interest 2016 36 months (1 Apr 2016-31.03.2019)
The Engine Room To consolidate the organisational development of the Engine Room and expand its support to human rights activists to integrate data and technology safely and effectively into their work. Based in locations around the world, the Engine Room also conducts applied research on the role of technology in advocacy, producing research and tools on the use of data by non-governmental organisations. 450'000.00 United States International Human Rights Supporting and protecting human rights defenders 2017 35 months (01 Jun 2017-29 May 2020)
The Foundling Museum To support the Foundling Museum in London to train young adults who grew up in institutional care to develop and deliver creative workshops at the Museum for children in care. Both the trainees and children will benefit from the project and will learn new skills and feel empowered. The Foundling Museum explores the history of the Foundling Hospital, the UK's first children's charity and first public art gallery. Through a dynamic programme of exhibitions and events, the Museum celebrates the ways in which artists of all disciplines have helped improve children's lives for over 275 years. 143'312.00 United Kingdom Special Interest 2016 36 months (1 Oct 2016-30.11.2019)
The Guernica Centre for International Justice To support transnational and international accountability strategies to tackle impunity in nine countries. The Guernica Centre for International Justice, part of the Guernica Group with offices in the UK, US and Spain, is an international collaboration of experienced litigators, investigators and other professionals working together to bring perpetrators of international crimes and grave human rights violations to justice and strengthen systems of accountability. 212'687.00 Worldwide International Human Rights Ending impunity for gross human rights violations 2018 23 months (1 Sep 2018-31 Aug 2020)

The Public Interest Law Center uses high-impact legal strategies to advance the civil, social, and economic rights of communities in the Philadelphia region facing discrimination, inequality, and poverty. 400'000.00 United States Housing and Homelessness Homelessness prevention 2018 35 months (1 Jan 2019-31 Dec 2021)

Young entrepreneurs in developing countries often have the best ideas for solving local problems, but they lack access to development funding. The Queen's Commonwealth Trust will work through partners to identify these projects and get start-up funds to them quickly; it will also provide mentoring and networking opportunities to help elevate good ideas and share best practice for replication elsewhere. 375'000.00 United Kingdom Special Interest 2017 35 months (01 Jan 2018-31 Dec 2020)

The Voices Project To support the UK-based 'The Syria Campaign' in its work to elevate Syrias heroes and build global support behind them. The Syria Campaign works remotely to create a bridge between those trapped inside Syria facing violence on all sides and the international community. Believing in freedom, democracy and peace, it works to raise awareness of civil society groups in media and popular culture. By doing so it hopes to encourage the sense that there is a Syria worth protecting. The Walking Classroom Institute To provide core support to the TWC, an organisation based in North Carolina, the US, that provides resources to educators to engage students physically, mentally and academically. With TWC materials, students take brisk 20-minute walks while listening to podcasts that are aligned with the common core standards for 4th and 5th grades. Students establish and maintain healthy lifestyle habits while building their health literacy and core content knowledge as they walk, listen and learn. 550'000.00 United States Special Interest 2016 65 months (1 Jul 2016-31.12.2021)

Tides Foundation To build relationships between people living in mobile homes (also known as manufactured homeowners) in the US, who number more than 9 million mainly low-income people in approximately 50,000 land-lease sites. The aim is to help enact policy change that supports all manufactured homeowners. Manufactured housing is a significant but unrecognised form of low-income housing and many of those living in this type of housing have limited rights and representation. Manufactured Housing Action is a growing national movement of manufactured homeowners who work to protect the affordability and quality of their communities through national, state and local campaigns. 493'440.00 United States Housing and Homelessness Homelessness prevention 2017 47 months (01 Nov 2017-31 Oct 2021)
